===========================================================
COPY AND PASTE THESE COMMANDS INTO YOUR HETZNER WEB CONSOLE
WHERE YOU'RE ALREADY LOGGED IN AS ROOT
===========================================================

Step 1: Create SSH directory
-----------------------------
mkdir -p ~/.ssh


Step 2: Add your SSH public key (COPY THIS ENTIRE BLOCK INCLUDING THE EOF MARKERS):
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cat > ~/.ssh/authorized_keys << 'EOF'
ssh-rsa  watka@DESKTOP-VUDL677
EOF


Step 3: Fix permissions
------------------------
chmod 700 ~/.ssh
chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys


Step 4: Verify it worked
-------------------------
cat ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
ls -la ~/.ssh/


===========================================================
AFTER RUNNING THESE IN THE HETZNER CONSOLE,
TEST FROM YOUR LOCAL MACHINE:
===========================================================

ssh root@91.99.166.104

(This should connect WITHOUT asking for a password)
